title: Mid-Level Backend Software Engineer
description:
At norbloc we build ecosystems for sharing of validated data, as well as solutions for financial institutions looking to digitize and improve the efficiency of client onboarding and data management processes. Our client portfolio includes government institutions and tier-1 financial organizations, reflecting norbloc's trusted partnerships with leading entities across different regions.
   

  

 We are now growing our Development team to support the expansion of our client portfolio and the ongoing development of our data sharing platforms across Europe and the MENA region. To this direction, we are seeking a
 **Backend Software Development Engineer,** 
 reporting to the Development Lead.
   

  

 By joining norbloc, you will have the exceptional opportunity to be part of a highly innovative and pioneering company. Our platforms are disrupting the status quo of how KYC is conducted, solving challenges that have existed for decades, and in doing so creating a new market segment where other innovative solutions and applications can thrive.
   

  

 The role is
 **hybrid** 
 and
 **full-time** 
 , based in
 **Athens or Stockholm.**
**Role Description**
 As a Fides Development Engineer, you will be part of the core team responsible for building and enhancing norbloc's data sharing platforms. You will collaborate with other developers, QA engineers, and product managers to design, implement, test, and deliver high-quality features. The role requires solid engineering skills, problem-solving ability, and a proactive mindset to adapt to different client requirements and project contexts.
   

  

**Duties And Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable features within the platform basis the product architecture and functionality
* Collaborate with the Development and cross-functional teams to translate requirements into technical specifications and working solutions
* Write clean, well-tested, and maintainable code, ensuring adherence to best practices
* Contribute to the design and documentation of APIs and integrations of the platform
* Optimize performance and security of the platform in line with client and regulatory requirements
* Participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback to peers
* Ensure unit testing of all developed modules and services
* Support troubleshooting, debugging, and resolution of issues across multiple environments
* Stay updated with emerging technologies to continuously improve platform capabilities


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of professional software development experience
* Strong knowledge of Node.js or Java/Spring, and modern frontend frameworks (Angular or React)
* Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred) and SQL optimization
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Git, and issue tracking systems (e.g., JIRA)
* Understanding of Agile methodologies and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Fluency in English
* Experience in Fintech, RegTech or enterprise SaaS and familiarity with blockchain-based platforms or distributed architectures will be considered as a plus


**Benefits**
* Become part of a friendly, innovative and ambitious team
* Learn and grow in a pioneering, high-growth environment
* Work with world-leading financial institutions and government entities
* Exposure to cutting edge technologies and methodologies
* Competitive compensation package

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
We at Umain are looking for
 **Senior Backend Engineers** 
 with a genuine enthusiasm for building robust solutions that power digital experiences — engineers ready to bring passion, creativity, and dedication with them.
   

  

 The role is broad but centered on backend technologies, offering the opportunity to work on a variety of projects for both Swedish and international companies.
   

  

 We work with many different tech stacks, but most of our projects are written in
 **Kotlin, Go, or TypeScript** 
 . Our approach is to use the tools best suited for each project, ensuring our teams are not locked into a single stack.
   

  

**We Have a Proven Track Record**
* 400M+ total app downloads
* 50M+ monthly active users
* Backends handling tens of thousands of requests per second
* Globally recognized, multi-market applications


 If working at scale with technology that truly makes an impact excites you, we believe you'll be a great fit at Umain.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Backend Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Building high-performance backend systems using modern languages like Go, NodeJS, Python, and Kotlin to power innovative experiences
* Using modern backend frameworks such as Fiber, Ktor, Express and FastAPI to create robust solutions.
* Designing and implementing cloud-native solutions across AWS, GCP and Azure, using Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) for resource management
* Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with containerized deployments and scaling strategies
* Developing robust data models and database architectures to support application requirements
* Participating in projects & teams alongside some of the largest and most forward-thinking brands on the planet


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

**Career Framework**
 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance**
 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations And Learning**
 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees**
 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

 Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?
   

  

 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Frontend Developer
description:

**Start is ASAP, 5 months contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.** 




  





 As an experienced frontend engineer, you will have a central role in realizing our vision to create an unmatched customer experience for our self-service platforms.
 



  





 You will be a part of the Selfservice team which has approximately 25 people across 2 sub teams.
 



  





 The frontend projects use a modern React stack with an emphasis on driving frontend technologies to enable to build great products. The developers decide on our tech stack, ensuring we stay as modern as possible.

**Also good to have skills:** 



* Vercel

* Headless CMS

**Who you are** 



* You are clever yet level-headed and analytical.
* You dare to try but are not foolhardy.
* You are energetic, outgoing, and accustomed to building relationships within and outside the team.
* Enjoy working in a team and cooperating with others but are also able to take initiatives to continuously improve and develop the project with a focus on performance and usability.
* With your true agile mindset and experience in sharing your agile knowledge, you bring structure to the team.
* A true team player, used to working in agile cross-functional teams, and taking great responsibility for your work and for the progress in the team.

 This is a full-time consultant position in Stockholm through Incluso. Start is in February 2026, 5 months

 Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
 



  





 For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal
 
 recruiter at Incluso.

title: Mobile Developer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO​**




 As a Mobile Developer, you'll ensure seamless and engaging experiences across smartphones, PCs, and other devices. Experience with multiple device types, payments, and iOS is highly valued. While Kotlin is the main language, JavaScript and TypeScript are also useful. Your work will cover POS sales, payments, back-office applications, mobile payments, self-checkout stations, and standout in-store payment solutions.
   

  





**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  





 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  





 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




 We are looking for people with…​
   

  




* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with mobile and front end focus.
* Proficiency in Android development in Kotlin.
* Proficiency in build secure applications with Microsoft Login and Single Sign-On capabilities.
* Experience in mobile development for multiple devices.
* Experience Integrate hardware and communicate effectively with Android applications.
* Experience to work with SDKs from external vendors.
* Experience in Consume web services (e.g., REST APIs).
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers and utilize Figma for design implementation.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge and apply basic Mobile Device Management (MDM) principles (e.g., Airwatch).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* IOS development, experience is a plus.
* Apply basic web development skills is a plus.



*And people who have* 
 :
   

  




* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Additional Information**

**WHO WE ARE** 
 ​
   

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 ​We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





**​WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
 ​
   

  





 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**JOIN US​** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 ​Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





 ​
 *\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*

title: Frontend Developer (React / Next.js)
description:
**Job Description**
 We're looking for a developer who thinks in components and user flows, not just pixels and layouts. You'll build modern React applications using Next.js and TypeScript, creating interfaces that solve real problems for our users.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**What You'll Actually Do**
 You'll own frontend experiences from concept to deployment. This means understanding what users actually need, proposing solutions that balance functionality with maintainability, and building interfaces that feel intuitive. You won't be translating Figma files into code—you'll be a partner in shaping what we build and how it works.
   

  

 You'll work within our existing ecosystem, which includes both modern React/Next.js applications and legacy Angular codebases. Your primary focus is building new features in Next.js, but you need to be comfortable navigating and occasionally working with what's already there.
   

  

**The AI Aspect**
 This is non-negotiable: you need to be actively exploring where AI can eliminate tedious work. We expect you to experiment with AI tools, identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks, and push the boundaries of what you can delegate. If you're not regularly discovering new ways to make AI do the boring parts, you're not the right fit.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**What We're Looking For:**
* 4-7 years of frontend development experience, with strong React and Next.js foundations
* Next.js expertise—you understand App Router vs Pages Router, server components, streaming, and when to use each approach
* TypeScript proficiency—you write type-safe code and understand how TypeScript improves maintainability
* React fundamentals—you know when to reach for context vs props, understand rendering behavior, and can optimize performance when needed
* RTK Query experience—you're comfortable with data fetching, caching strategies, and managing server state efficiently
* Node.js experience—you can work with API routes, understand backend concepts, and collaborate effectively with backend developers
* Component thinking—you can break down UI into reusable, composable pieces that make sense
* Active AI experimentation—you're already using AI assistants in your workflow and constantly looking for new applications
* Problem-solving mindset—you see frontend development as solving user problems, not just implementing designs
* Communication clarity—you can discuss trade-offs and technical decisions with both technical and non-technical stakeholders


**Strong Plus If You Have**
* Angular experience—you can work in our existing Angular applications when needed


**Technical Environment**
* Primary: React, Next.js, TypeScript, RTK Query
* Secondary: Node.js for API integration and understanding
* Legacy: Angular applications
* Modern tooling with established patterns
* We value consistency and maintainability over novelty


**What Makes Someone Excel Here**
 You care about user experience but understand the technical constraints. You write components that other developers enjoy using. You'd rather simplify than add complexity. You see patterns and create abstractions that make sense. You're comfortable saying "I don't know the best approach here" and then researching options. You view AI as a genuine collaborator in your work, not just a fancy autocomplete.
   

  

 #Hybrid
   

  

**About Us**
**Our People, Our Culture**
 For more than 50 years, Verisk has helped property and casualty insurers make smarter decisions about risk through AI-powered risk modeling, advanced analytics, and technology solutions spanning the entire policy lifecycle. We are a leading strategic data, analytics, and technology partner to the global insurance industry, guided by core values of learning, caring, and results while maintaining the highest ethical standards as stewards of the industry's most comprehensive datasets. Learn more about Verisk and what we are doing within the insurance industry.
   

  

 When you join Verisk, you become part of a diverse global team with over 7,500 professionals in 30 plus countries, making work that matters. We're certified by Great Place to Work, reflecting our commitment to inclusivity, employee engagement, and wellbeing. At Verisk, your growth is a priority—from professional development and tuition benefits to a supportive, flexible workplace culture, we support your continued growth.
   

  

**Our Culture** 
 : Explore our inclusive, people-first culture that fosters innovation, collaboration, and belonging.
   

  

**Awards & Recognition** 
 : See why Verisk is consistently recognized as a Great Place to Work™ around the world.
   

  

**Our Businesses** 
 : Learn about the diverse industries we serve — from insurance and energy to financial services and beyond.
   

  

**Life at Verisk** 
 : Discover what it’s like to work at Verisk through employee stories, team highlights, and culture moments.
   

  

**Careers at Verisk** 
 : Join a global team of problem-solvers and innovators doing meaningful work that’s shaping the future of industries. Whether you're just starting out or looking to take your career to the next level, Verisk offers growth, purpose, and a people-first culture
   

  

 Let’s build something meaningful together!
   

  

 Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.
   

  

 All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Verisk’s minimum hiring age is 18 except in countries with a higher age limit subject to applicable law.
   

  

 At Verisk, we provide a competitive compensation package aligned with market benchmarks and individual experience, disclosed transparently in accordance with applicable pay transparency regulations. In addition to base salary, eligible roles may include a range of incentive opportunities designed based on market research and our internal grading structure.
   

  

 Our benefits portfolio varies by location; however, a typical package includes medical coverage, life insurance, pension plans, and paid time off in line with local labor laws.
   

  

 We also foster a work environment focused on well-being and career development. Additional perks may include wellness initiatives, fitness programs, and team-building activities.
   

  

 https://www.verisk.com/company/careers/
   

  

 Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine, or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.
   

  

 Verisk Employee Privacy Notice

title: TEAM LEAD & BACKEND SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
description:
THE WOW
   


 As a Team Lead at Betsson Group, you will lead a team of talented people and take overall responsibility for team performance. As the Team Lead, you will take an active role in driving the delivery of your team and promoting a healthy team spirit and culture. You will also participate as a developer in designing and developing next generation Engagement products for the iGaming industry.  
 


  

 ABOUT THE JOB
   



 As part of this team, you will use cutting edge technology to develop highly scalable and resilient application. As a team lead you will also enable us to get these applications into the hands of our users safely, quickly, and sustainably. In Engagement Area, We develop products to boost customer engagement. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience on the market, and we do that through personalized communication, interesting and fun promotions, and gamification. We work closely with our commercial users to ensure we deliver the best CRM tools and products. All designed and developed by us and delivered safely, quickly and sustainably using best-if-bread technologies and processes. 
 



  

 As a Team Lead and Backend Developer, your day to day will look like
   

  
* People management, mentoring and coaching developers, taking part in recruiting and onboarding, performance reviews, personal development planning and 1-to-1’s.
  
* Close collaboration with Product Managers, Architects, and Stakeholders to understand and implement business requirements.
  
* Software development according to modern best practices and principles.
  
* Taking part in the decision-making process for design or improvement of application architecture, solution development, architecture, and code review
  


  

 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
   

  
* Experience in software development for more than 5 years
  
* Experience of managing teams of software engineers
  
* Strong leadership and communication skills
  
* Agile mindset, business goals orientation
  
* Excellent knowledge and experience in C#, .NET Framework, and .NET Core
  


  

 WHAT DOES OUR TECH STACK LOOK LIKE?
   


 At Betsson, we pride ourselves on adaptability and keeping up with the latest technologies. Our current tech stack looks like this
 


  

  
* C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core,
  
* AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  
* PostgreSQL, MSSQL, Redis, Couchbase
  
* Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ
  
* Prometheus, Loki, Grafana
  
* GitHub
  


  

 WHAT WE OFFER
   


 Life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


  

 CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?
   


 If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV.
 


  


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Assignment description:
 



 This assignment involves strengthening a development team responsible for building and maintaining a national digital infrastructure for health, healthcare, and social care. The infrastructure enables secure information sharing between healthcare systems and contributes to improved healthcare quality, enhanced patient safety, a stronger patient role, and reduced administrative workload for healthcare professionals.
 







 As a Full-Stack Developer, you will work closely with system developers, UX specialists, and stakeholders to design, develop, and enhance digital services using modern web and backend technologies. The work is conducted in an agile environment with a strong focus on quality, test automation, and sustainable development.
 







**Job Description:** 








 The assignment focuses on strengthening a development team responsible for building and maintaining a national digital infrastructure for health, healthcare, and social care. The purpose of the infrastructure is to enable secure and efficient information sharing between healthcare systems, contributing to improved healthcare quality, enhanced patient safety, a stronger patient role, and reduced administrative workload for healthcare professionals.
 







 As a Full-Stack Developer, you will work closely with system developers, UX specialists, and stakeholders to design, develop, and further enhance digital services using modern web and backend technologies. The work is carried out in an agile environment with a strong focus on quality, test automation, and sustainable solutions.
 







**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Analyze business and technical requirements and propose suitable technical solutions
* Design, develop, further develop, and maintain services and system functionality
* Develop user-friendly, responsive graphical user interfaces
* Build and maintain backend services and REST-based APIs
* Work according to test-driven development (TDD) principles and implement automated tests
* Contribute to system documentation and technical specifications
* Collaborate closely with UX specialists and stakeholders in solution development
* Participate actively in agile development teams and ceremonies







**Mandatory Requirements:** 








 Competence Level 2:
 


* Approximately 3 years of professional experience
* Experience from several similar assignments
* Ability to independently carry out defined tasks with some supervision
* At least 3 years of experience as a Full-Stack System Developer, including GUI development
* At least 3 years of experience with Java (acquired within the last 5 years)
* At least 3 years of experience with Vue.js (acquired within the last 5 years)
* At least 1 year of experience developing REST-based services (within the last 3 years)
* At least 3 years of experience with test-driven development and test automation, of which at least 2 years were acquired within the last 5 years
* At least 1 year of experience working in agile development teams
* Relevant university or college education, or equivalent practical experience
* Very good verbal and written communication skills in Swedish
* Consultant location must be Kalmar or Stockholm











**Desired Qualifications:** 



* Strong knowledge of core web technologies for creating responsive and user-friendly interfaces
* Experience with modern Java-based microservice frameworks such as Spring Boot, Quarkus, or equivalent
* Experience working with container-based technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and/or OpenShift
* Experience publishing or contributing to open source software
* Experience working with FHIR or other healthcare interoperability standards
* Experience in requirements analysis and close collaboration with clients to break down needs into solution proposals, prototypes, and implementations
* Working Methodology
* Agile development methods
* Test-driven development and automated testing
* Close collaboration with UX, development teams, and stakeholders
* Focus on quality, security, and long-term maintainability

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
I have a new role for an experienced Salesforce Developer to work for a trusted partner specializing in delivering personalized solutions for investments, pensions, and corporate benefits. Known for its transparency, innovation, and sustainability, it combines cutting-edge digital tools with a client-focused approach.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As a Senior Salesforce Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and implementing tailored solutions within the Salesforce platform. Your expertise will contribute directly to achieving our company goals and enhancing business operations.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and implement customized solutions on the Salesforce platform to support business functions and project goals.
* Develop and maintain Visualforce, Apex, Lightning components, and integrations with third-party solutions.
* Perform data migrations, integrations, and deployments using tools such as Data Loader, Workbench, and Change Sets.
* Collaborate with internal departments to ensure the Salesforce environment meets business needs in terms of functionality and performance.
* Provide technical leadership, training, and mentorship to junior developers and team members.
* Stay current with Salesforce releases, features, and best practices, recommending improvements as needed.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* At least 5 years as a Salesforce Developer, with expertise in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning components, and Salesforce integrations.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture, data models, and best practices.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
* Strong communication skills to effectively translate business requirements into technical solutions.
* Experience with Agile/Scrum
* Proficiency in Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
* Familiarity with processes and tools like Azure DevOps and Git
* Knowledge of Vlocity and OmniStudio is a big plus
* Salesforce Platform Developer I and II are meritorious



  





 This is a great opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects that drive business transformation

title: Embedded Software Engineer (Contract)
description:
**EMBEDDED SOFTWARE ENGINEER (CONTRACT)** 









**Location:** 
 Gothenburg (hybrid on-site)
 



**Contract:** 
 12 months,
 



**Rate:** 
**700–850 SEK/hour (B2B/freelance)** 




  





**About the role** 




 We are seeking a highly capable Embedded Software Engineer to join a fast-moving technology team in Gothenburg, supporting next-generation industrial and mobility systems. This is a hands-on role working close to hardware, real-time systems, and safety-critical software.
 



  





 You will be working in a collaborative, agile environment where code quality, reliability, and performance are essential.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, develop, and maintain embedded software in C/C++
* Work with RTOS and/or Embedded Linux platforms
* Implement and debug low-level drivers and middleware
* Integrate software with sensors, actuators, and communication buses
* Support testing, validation, and troubleshooting using hardware tools
* Collaborate with electronics engineers and system architects
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks








**Essential Skills & Experience** 



* Strong commercial experience with C and/or C++ in embedded systems
* Experience with RTOS (FreeRTOS, QNX, VxWorks) or Embedded Linux
* Hands-on work with microcontrollers (ARM Cortex or similar)
* Experience with communication protocols such as CAN, SPI, I2C, UART, or Ethernet
* Comfortable debugging at both software and hardware levels
* Familiar with Git, build systems, and automated testing








**Desirable (not essential)** 



* Automotive, robotics, or industrial automation experience
* Functional safety exposure (ISO 26262 or similar)
* Python for tooling and test automation








 If you’re available immediately or within 2–4 weeks, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Creative Developer
description:
Most Studios is looking for a Creative Developer to join our team full time in Stockholm. In this role, you will bridge design and technology, bringing digital concepts to life through refined interfaces, smooth interactions, and high quality front end craftsmanship. You will collaborate closely with designers, strategists, and product teams to build websites and experiences that are visually striking, fast, and delightful to use.
 



  





 You will work across the full digital lifecycle, from early concept explorations to polished executions. Your work will ensure that our creative vision is implemented with precision, scalability, and performance in mind.
 



  





 Beyond hands-on implementation, you’ll also contribute as a technical advisor—helping guide strategic decisions about platforms, integrations, and architecture to deliver the best solutions for our clients.
 



  





 You’ll be joining a small, tight-knit team and working alongside a senior creative developer who’s happy to collaborate, share knowledge, and support you when you need it.
 



  





**Examples of our work** 



* ingrid.com (Webflow)
* tandemhealth.ai (Webflow)
* legora.com (Framer)



  





**What we are looking for** 



* A strong portfolio demonstrating modern front end development, animation, and interaction work
* Proven experience building websites with Webflow and Framer—not just using standard features, but bending them to your will with custom solutions
* Platform versatility beyond Webflow—experience with WordPress (headless and custom themes), HubSpot CMS, Framer, and headless solutions like Prismic, Sanity, or Contentful
* Experience with TypeScript, Next.js/React, and REST/GraphQL APIs for fully custom builds when projects call for it
* Understanding of how websites connect to the broader digital ecosystem, including third-party integrations like CRM systems, marketing automation, and analytics tools
* Interest in technical leadership—helping guide clients and internal teams toward the right platforms, tools, and architecture for each project
* Project management sensibilities—comfortable scoping work, communicating with stakeholders, and keeping things on track
* Strong Figma skills—you’re comfortable navigating design files and collaborating directly with designers
* Hands-on experience with animation tools like GSAP, Lottie, Webflow Interactions, or custom CSS/JS animations
* Comfortable with AI-assisted development—you’ve moved past test phase into daily use
* A sharp eye for design and the taste to know when something feels off
* A problem-solver who’s not afraid to ask for help when stuck
* Awareness of performance, accessibility, and best practices in front end engineering
* Experience working in a design agency or fast moving product environment



  





**Responsibilities** 



* **Build** 
 Develop responsive, high quality websites and interactive experiences based on design specifications
* **Collaborate** 
 Work closely with designers to maintain design integrity throughout implementation
* **Prototype** 
 Create functional prototypes to explore animation, structure, and interaction concepts
* **Optimize** 
 Ensure strong performance, accessibility, and clean code across all projects
* **Innovate** 
 Explore new tools, frameworks, and creative technologies that elevate our digital work



  





**What you can expect from us** 



* Fantastic office at Skeppsbron 16
* Competitive salary
* 4,5 percent pension on top of monthly salary
* 3000 SEK per year for health related expenses
* 5 weeks yearly vacation
* Fully equipped MacBook Pro and iPhone, with phone bill covered
* Exceptional parental leave policy, 90 percent of salary plus 3000 SEK per month
* Genuine commitment to work life balance
* A supportive, collaborative team rooted in entrepreneurship and craft



  





 At Most Studios, we create meaningful digital experiences that elevate brands and drive real business impact. Our team spans designers, strategists, product thinkers, and entrepreneurs who have shaped some of the most exciting brands and digital products in the market. We collaborate with industry leaders and build our own ventures, always pushing creativity and innovation forward.
 



  





 If you want to help shape the next generation of digital experiences, send your portfolio and a short introduction to talent@moststudios.com.

title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
Visste du att 6 miljarder kronor i försäkringspengar aldrig hämtas ut i Sverige varje år?
 
 Det beror på att processen är krånglig, tidskrävande och överväldigande. Det vill vi ändra på! På Insurello bygger vi en plattform som gör det lättare för folk att få den ersättning de har rätt till. Vi har redan hjälpt 50 000 personer att få ut över en miljard kronor – och nu växlar vi upp! Är du vår nästa
 **Fullstack Software Engineer** 
 som vill göra skillnad på riktigt för miljoner människor?
 



**Varför Insurello?** 



* Gör skillnad på riktigt: Du får vara med och förändra en stel bransch med teknik som faktiskt hjälper folk.
* Jobba i empowered team, cross-functional team med frihet och ägandeskap att påverka teknikval, produktens roadmap och hur ni jobbar.
* Jobba i ett varm, inbjudande och inkluderande klimat där vi älskar samarbete, kunskapsdelning och att ha kul på vägen.


 Vad du kommer att göra
 * Utveckla vår produkt både strategiskt och tekniskt i ett cross-functional empowered team.
* Bygga smarta fullstack-lösningar med fokus på funktionell programmering.
* Djupdyka i systemdesign, event-driven design och cloud-arkitektur.
* Köra par- och mobprogrammering.
* Utforska hur AI kan göra både utvecklingen och kundupplevelsen ännu vassare.



**Vår tech-stack:** 



* Programmeringsspråk: Elm, TypeScript, F#, ASP.NET Core.
* Databas
 **:** 
 PostgreSQL
* Data och events: Event sourcing, RabbitMQ
* Infrastruktur: AWS.


 Vem är du?
 
**Teknisk kompetens:** 



* Du har 6+ års erfarenhet och älskar fullstack-utveckling.
* Du är nyfiken på (eller expert på) funktionella språk som Elm, F# eller liknande.
* Du har koll på AWS och använder gärna AI-verktyg för att jobba smartare.
* Kunskaper inom modellering av system, gärna domain driven.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med event sourcing och event-drivna system.
* Du behärskar både svenska och engelska obehindrat.



**Din personlighet:** 



* Du är nyfiken, prestigelös och trivs med att samarbeta fram pragmatiska lösningar.
* Du är en "product-minded" kodare som ser både kundnytta och affärsmöjligheter.
* Du vågar ta plats, dela dina idéer och utmana oss att bli ännu bättre!


 Kultur och förmåner
 
 Vi jobbar enligt våra values:
 


* We care for people – främjande av inkludering, empati och support.
* We innovate for impact – skapa värde och meningsfulla lösningar för våra kunder.
* We nurture trust – vi värdesätter transparens och samarbete i allt vi gör.



  





 När det gäller Product & Tech-teamet är vårt manifest enkelt:
 


* Tydlighet framför komplexitet
* Lärande genom experiment
* Gemensam riktning, lokala beslut
* Kvalitet genom samarbete
* Enkelhet och kostnadseffektivitet i allt vi bygger



  





 Om du brinner för fullstack-utveckling, moderna molnteknologier och att utforska hur AI kan lyfta både utvecdkling och kundvärde, så vill vi gärna prata mer med dig.
 



  





 Våra förmåner:
 



 🌴 30 dagars betald semester
 



 🌿 Tjänstepension via Avanza
 



 🏋️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr
 



 ⏱ Flexibla hybridarbetsmöjligheter med teamet baserat i Stockholm (vi jobbar från kontoret 1–2 dagar/vecka)
 



 🫄 Föräldralön
 



 🎐 Personliga terapisamtal
 



 🛡 Olycksfallsförsäkring som gäller dygnet runt – både i arbetet och på fritiden
 



 🥐 Teamfrukost varje vecka
 



 💃 Regelbundna after works och företagsevent – inklusive en årlig offsite i maj
 



  





 Kom och förändra försäkringsbranschen med oss! 🚀

title: Mobile App Platform Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of banks, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery we are building the next generation investment platform.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value to our customers with continuous releases several times a week.
   

  

**This is you**
 To thrive in this role, we believe that you love to contribute to a state-of-the-art developer experience and to work on improving and modernizing our mobile technology stack. You can easily connect with people, have a solution-oriented mindset and are happy to help and support others.
   

  

**As a Mobile App Platform Engineer, You**
* Are confident in mobile development. Our tech stack includes JavaScript/TypeScript, React Native, Redux, RTK Query, Testing library, MSW, React Navigation, GitHub actions and Expo
* Have a birds eye perspective when setting the architecture for the future
* Are motivated when faced with complex technical problems
* Are eager to automate things


**A Bonus Is If You**
* Are knowledgeable in Java and Terraform
* Are interested or have experience with the rest of the tech stack, which includes GCP, Nginx, Docker, Kubernetes and ArgoCD


**Nordnetters**
* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improving to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to our goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure


**What We Offer**
* Experienced team which build own products and support other teams and products
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation
* Flexible work setup (from office or hybrid)


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. We are embracing the agile way of working. Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do. We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. Visit us on:
 **www.nordnetab.com**
**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
