title: Digital Designer
description:
**Digital designer (UI/visual)**
 At Above, you’ll bring bold ideas to life for some of the world’s most exciting brands, diving into a mix of daring projects alongside creative minds from every corner of the industry. We are a warm, multidisciplinary team that thrives on pushing the boundaries of digital design — supported by expert coaches, caring leaders, and a feedback-driven culture where everyone grows together.
   

  

 Once here, you will be an integral part of our design team, and have the opportunity to proactively contribute to all stages of the design process, from research to visual concepts, from design explorations to crafting compelling experiences.
   

  

**About Us**
 We believe in changing behaviors for the better, make businesses flourish, and help people in their everyday lives. And most importantly, having fun doing so. We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. We know that creativity needs to be free to flourish.
   

  

 We share a fundamental passion for innovation and design. Through our curiosity we build deeper relationships with people, industries and problems around us. Our designs are never better than our understanding of the problem we’re trying to solve.
   

  

 We are collaborators and believe that effective teams achieve world class results. Prestige is left at the doorstep.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for a self-starter who loves teaming up with creative minds from all disciplines, turning big ideas into even bigger results. You see challenges as opportunities, always focused on finding smart solutions that make a real impact for clients and colleagues alike. Your commitment shines through in everything you do  . You bring positive energy, spreading good vibes and a service-minded spirit wherever you go. As a true ambassador for Above, you represent us with professionalism and pride—inside and outside the studio.
   

  

**Bullet lists are hard to love, we know. You don’t have to check all of them, but it’s great if you recognize yourself in the general theme below**
* You’ve got a bachelor’s degree in visual design (or something equally awesome).
* You bring 3–5 years of visual/UI design experience, with a passion for both classic and quirky digital touchpoints — think websites and apps but also business dashboards or even EV charger screens.
* You have an eye for detail and you’re passionate about making visual design that stands out, moves the user and pushes the limits.
* You have an ability to turn business requirements, goals, and user needs into design solutions.
* You can explain and document your process, present your work and communicate your decisions.
* You have proficiency in relevant tools such as Figma.
* You’re used to the high paced agency life and love working closely with all kinds of clients.
* Bonus points if you’re skilled in design systems or motion design.
* You’re fluent in English (and if you speak Swedish, that’s a cherry on top—but not a dealbreaker!).


**A few things to keep in mind**
* Be sure to include both your CV and a portfolio that shows off your design skills.
* This role is based in Stockholm, and we love seeing each other in person — either at our inspiring office or with clients. If you’re not in Stockholm yet but ready to make the move, let us know!
* Sorry, freelancers—this one’s for future full-time Above crew only.


 We’re on the hunt for several talented designers and will keep applications open until we’ve found our dream team. If you haven’t heard from us yet, don’t worry—you’re still in the running!

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**About Elite Prospects** 




  





 Elite Prospects is the world’s leading hockey platform and the central hub connecting fans, players, agents, scouts, and executives. As the true gateway to hockey, we create opportunities for players while serving as the global community destination for everything related to the game.
 



 With more than thirty thousand paying subscribers, over five hundred thousand registered members, and six million unique monthly visitors, Elite Prospects continues to cement its role as the digital heartbeat of hockey. We are now looking for a UI UX Designer who wants to help shape the future of hockey technology.
 



  





  





**The Role** 




  





 As a UI UX Designer at Elite Prospects, you will own the design value chain for your team. You will lead everything from user research and understanding briefs to concept development, sketching, and handover to developers.
 



 This role requires more than designing within existing constraints. You will need to immerse yourself in the full customer journey, identify opportunities, and propose new ways of packaging or rethinking solutions to achieve the best possible user experience. Your ability to understand users, data, and the complexity of the product will be central to your daily work.
 



 You will work independently as the sole designer in a cross functional team together with product manager and developers. At the same time, you will have access to senior designers who can provide feedback and act as a sounding board for ideas.
 



  





  





**Who You Are** 




  





 Requirements
 



  




* University degree in engineering or a similar relevant field
* Minimum five years of experience working in UI UX across the full process from ideation to implementation and iteration
* Experience working with complex digital products - both web & app - catering to several different user groups
* Experience in data visualization is a strong plus
* Fluency in both Swedish and English
* Strong interest in and knowledge of hockey
* Confident in your professional role and comfortable working independently in cross functional teams



  





 Personal qualities
 



  




* Engaged and passionate about design and product development
* Action oriented with the ability to turn abstract ideas into concrete concepts and designs that create value
* Curious about new tools and ways of working, and comfortable experimenting with AI to improve your design workflow



  





**Team and Workplace** 




 You will join our Product and Tech team based at our main office in central Stockholm. We also have a tech office in Malmö as well as team members working remotely across Europe, North America, and Thailand.
 



  





  





**What We Offer** 




  




* The opportunity to work on a very exciting, fast growing product that we are fully committed to
* A talented, friendly team that values collaboration and truly enjoys working together
* A culture that includes
* An annual company conference bringing together colleagues from across three continents
* Monthly learning sessions focused on personal and professional development
* Frequent after work activities and fun office games



  





 If you want to help build the future of hockey technology and work with a team that plays to win together, Elite Prospects is ready to welcome you onto the ice.

title: Product Designer
description:
Anyfin is on a mission to change millions of financial lives for the better. Since our start over seven years ago, we’ve been doing this one customer at a time — with user experience and design at the core of our offering. But we aim higher; new customers, new products, and new design challenges. That’s why we are currently looking for a
 **Product Designer** 
 to join our Design team.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 Your focus will be on creating intuitive, user-centric solutions that truly help people understand and manage their finances — every single day. This means collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Customer Service teams across all our markets to ensure we’re building thoughtful, effective, and accessible product experiences.
   

  

 A big part of your work will involve driving design efforts from exploration to launch and beyond. You’ll rapidly prototype, iterate, and explore multiple directions to uncover the best possible solutions. You will also contribute to and evolve our shared Design System, ensuring visual consistency and design quality across the entire product ecosystem.
   

  

 We adopt a hypothesis-driven approach, grounding our work in user feedback, data, and structured thinking. At Anyfin, the products you design genuinely matter — helping people take control of their personal finances.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone with a strong passion for visual excellence, systems thinking, and user experience — someone who wants to stay hands-on with the craft while collaborating across teams. You inspire those around you and help raise the overall design quality across the organization. And yes, here come the bullet points (they do serve a purpose):
   

  

* A proven track record as a product designer in a fast-paced environment, ideally designing B2C products that make a real difference to users.
* Strong UI craft and a solid understanding of UX design patterns.
* A portfolio that demonstrates clear, structured thinking and a user-centered design approach.
* Experience driving design work end-to-end: exploration, prototyping, iteration, delivery, and continuous improvement.
* The ability to quickly explore multiple design directions and use feedback to guide decision-making.
* Strong communication skills — you present your ideas clearly, manage stakeholders effectively, and tie design decisions to measurable outcomes and business goals.
* Experience collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams.
* Openness to feedback and a desire to grow both personally and in how design impacts teams and the broader organization.
* Bonus points if you’ve contributed to or scaled design systems across teams.


**What We Offer**
 We offer you the chance to be part of something truly meaningful. You’ll work alongside colleagues who are ridiculously passionate about users and the experience we deliver to them. We promise you’ll be challenged, supported, and given the opportunity to work on things that actually matter.
   

  

 Then there’s the competitive compensation package, our centrally located and cozy office, extra time off on your birthday, and a bunch of other benefits. But we’ll get to all that in due time. For now, begin your journey with us by clicking
 **"Apply"** 
 below.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Industrial Design Internship
description:
Above is now looking for talented Industrial Design Interns to join the creative team in both our Malmö & Stockholm studios throughout 2026. The next intake will be around February/March, as well as in August/September post-summer - but we are open to discussing individual setups outside the usual cycle. Our internships are always on-site for best exposure and collaboration, and we require a duration of 5-6 months to really get to know each other.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As an Industrial Design Intern at Above, you will get the opportunity to work with multi-disciplinary project teams on a wide variety of cutting-edge design & innovation projects for some of the world's most exciting brands.
   

  

 Once here, you will be an integral part of our design team, and have the opportunity to proactively contribute to all stages of the design process, from research to concept definition, from hands-on prototyping to crafting compelling visions. With strong conceptual thinking and a fluid software toolbox, you will have the opportunity to shape excellent project deliveries through craft and creativity. You will get the chance to work on focused industrial design engagements, and equally integrate into larger, cross-functional project constellations as part of diverse, mixed-competency teams - acting as an ambassador of the industrial design discipline while collaborating with senior colleagues.
   

  

 Our work is exciting and diverse in nature, spanning high-volume consumer products, smart home devices, furniture, robotics, future mobility experiences, progressive healthcare solutions, packaging and many more. We create impact across all levels and horizons - from category-defining hero products to multi-dimensional portfolio strategies and shaping compelling future visions alike.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* An inspiring design portfolio; strong conceptual thinking and creativity
* Aesthetic sensibility balanced with a thoughtful, user-centered design approach
* Ability to adapt methods, thought-process and approach to project needs
* Fluency in CAD (Solidworks, Rhino or similar), including surfacing skills
* High-quality visualisation & animation output to express ideas and tell stories
* Hands-on mentality and familiarity with physical front-end prototyping
* Curiosity for sustainability, material innovation & manufacturing processes
* A humble, self-driven and optimistic attitude; willingness and desire to learn
* Team player, with good verbal & visual communication skills


 We are also very much interested in receiving applications from individuals that bridge disciplines or have unique profiles in-between the traditional molds - let’s talk!
   

  

**Join our team**
 Please submit your portfolio and short motivation statement. Interviews are happening on a rolling basis. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered. Our internships are always paid, and we are able to offer support with visa & work permit processes for successful international candidates.
   

  

 We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Content Designer - Consumer Experience
description:
Help design how Spotify communicates, guides, and supports listeners through intelligent, intuitive experiences. We are seeking a Senior Content Designer to craft the language, systems, and behaviors that define how people interact with Spotify’s AI-powered and traditional product surfaces.
   

  

 This role sits at the intersection of language, interaction, and adaptive technology. You’ll craft experiences that feel clear, warm, and unmistakably Spotify — whether through system messages, guidance flows, dynamic interfaces, or emerging AI features. The work you do will influence how our products speak, respond, and evolve across millions of moments every single day.
   

  

 Whether your background is in Content Design, UX Writing, Product Design, or Systems Design, you’ll have space to explore innovative ways to develop robust editorial models, and help define the next generation of content-led experiences at Spotify.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Craft world-class content design for our mobile and partner experiences.
* Define the frameworks, patterns, and editorial logic that guide content across Spotify’s product landscape.
* Build scalable systems that bring clarity and coherence to multi-surface experiences — from mobile and desktop to voice and AI-supported interactions.
* Evaluate content through a lens of accuracy, clarity, inclusivity, and ethical responsibility. Hold a high bar for tone, taxonomy, structure, and narrative coherence. Contribute to systems and processes that help teams supervise and improve AI-generated output over time, ensuring it remains safe, reliable, and aligned with Spotify’s values.
* Work with cross-functional partners to test ideas, explore new techniques, and strengthen our shared craft. You’ll help teams build confidence in content-led decision making, share insights, and contribute to a culture that values thoughtful, human-centered communication.


 Who You Are
   

  

* An expert content designer who has built content within digital products, ideally across sophisticated, multi-modal systems.
* Good understanding of how language influences user experience and system responses, and you’re comfortable crafting for environments where logic, interaction, and narrative intersect.
* Ability to collaborate well within multidisciplinary teams and bring a curious, inclusive mentality to solving problems.
* Care deeply about clarity, accessibility, and crafting experiences that support users of many backgrounds and needs.
* Energized by evolving spaces — from AI-supported interfaces to new patterns for guiding global audiences — and you bring structure, insight, and creativity to emerging challenges.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: UX Lead
description:
At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain and instead be of gain to both our clients and their customers – improving their relations.
 



  





 To ensure continuous growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are now looking for a UX Lead to join our team.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As UX Lead at Billogram, you will be the key driver in defining and developing our entire UX capability. Your mission is to move beyond executing design requests to becoming a strategic partner who ensures user insights and data directly drive our product roadmap.
 



  





 This is a high-impact role where you take full ownership of the UX vision at Billogram. You will be the driving force behind all UX design, simultaneously setting the strategy, principles, and key metrics and being hands-on to deliver immediate value to the Product Teams. Working closely with Product Managers and developers, you will ensure a cohesive, high-quality experience across the entire customer journey.
 



  





**Primary Responsibilities:** 



* **Own & Define UX Strategy:** 
 Define Billogram’s UX Design principles and strategy, establish key metrics for UX impact, and set the ways of working to fully integrate UX into the product development lifecycle.
* **Drive End-to-End Execution:** 
 Lead the full design process from discovery to delivery. This includes hands-on work in user research, data analysis, high-fidelity prototyping (UI), and writing in-product copy.
* **Improvement & Innovation:** 
 Actively seek opportunities to improve and change processes, leverage new technologies like AI to enhance ways of working, and ensure the function is constantly learning and evolving.
* **Stakeholder & Change Advocacy:** 
 Build strong relationships and actively champion the UX vision, communicating insights to Product Managers, developers, and other stakeholders to foster organizational alignment.
* **Elevate Product Experience:** 
 Act as the key player in rolling out important product functionality and ensuring a cohesive, delightful experience across all customer journeys.
* **Systems & Automation:** 
 Develop the strategy for our design system and internal automation to ensure a highly efficient workflow. This includes optimizing how we build flows and automating processes for in-product copy and translations, ensuring a cohesive and high-quality experience.



  





**What we are looking for:** 




 You are a pragmatic, positive, and naturally curious individual who takes full responsibility for your work. You have no prestige when it comes to hands-on work and are motivated by problem-solving. You are deeply customer-focused, constantly striving to achieve that delightful "wow" experience for our users. You are also confident but remain humble, enabling you to effectively manage stakeholders and drive successful collaboration across the organization. Finally, you have strong communication skills which you leverage to champion the UX vision and effectively drive organizational alignment.
 



  





**What will help you succeed:** 



* Several years of practical experience across the full UX spectrum: research, user testing, high-fidelity prototyping (UI), and writing.
* A strong, hands-on ability to build advanced, interactive prototypes using code or technical frameworks to test and validate experiences, while mastering modern design tools (for example Figma).
* Proven experience leveraging AI/ML technologies not only in the product design itself, but also to significantly enhance your own design workflow and processes.
* Proven ability to define a UX Design Strategy and establish KPIs to measure the business impact of UX work.
* Proven experience in driving organizational or process change is beneficial.
* Experience from the Fintech sector or working with complex payment/billing products is a plus.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is required. Fluency in Swedish is a plus.



  





**What we offer:** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





*At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.*

title: Grafisk formgivare/Orginalare
description:
Vill du arbeta med grafisk formgivning som blir en del av upplevelsen för tusentals gäster? Parks and Resorts söker nu en Grafisk formgivare/Originalare (frilans) som vill skapa visuella uttryck tätt kopplade till våra parker och deras unika världar.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Grafisk formgivare/Originalare på Parks and Resorts inhousebyrå blir du en del av vårt kreativa team och arbetar med formgivning som stärker parkernas tematisering och helhetsupplevelse. Du producerar främst material för stillbild och tryck, med möjlighet att även arbeta med rörligt innehåll.
 



  





 I rollen ingår bland annat att:
 


* Ta fram och färdigställa grafiskt material för menyer, skyltning, kampanjer och trycksaker
* Arbeta med layout och originalproduktion för både fysiska och digitala enheter
* Säkerställa att det visuella uttrycket samspelar med parkernas tematisering
* Arbeta nära restauranger och matenheter, men även med övrig parkkommunikation
* Ansvara för original hela vägen från idé till färdig produktion



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har en stark känsla för form, layout och typografi och som trivs med att arbeta noggrant och kvalitetsmedvetet. Du är trygg i att anpassa uttryck efter olika stilar, teman och miljöer och vet när ett lekfullt, färgstarkt uttryck passar bättre än ett mer nedtonat.
 



  





 Vi ser gärna att du:
 


* Har cirka 1–3 års erfarenhet som grafisk formgivare/originalare
* Har goda kunskaper inom layout, typografi och originalproduktion
* Är mycket trygg i Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator och InDesign
* Har erfarenhet av att anpassa formgivning efter olika visuella uttryck och miljöer
* Har arbetat med visuella uttryck för restauranger, retail eller liknande miljöer (meriterande)
* Har erfarenhet av Figma, rörlig grafik i After Effects och/eller grundläggande 3D (t.ex. Blender eller Cinema 4D) (meriterande)
* Har en utbildning inom design, exempelvis från Berghs, Beckmans, HDK eller motsvarande (meriterande)



  





 Kort sagt: du ser till att form, typografi och detaljer sitter och att varje leverans känns självklar i sin tematiserade miljö.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i en kreativ och varierad miljö där formgivning blir en viktig del av upplevelsen för våra gäster. Du blir en del av ett engagerat inhouse-team och får arbeta med projekt som sträcker sig över flera parker, miljöer och uttryck.
 



  





**Praktisk information om tjänsten** 



* Roll: Grafisk formgivare/Originalare
* Anställningsform: Konsult/Frilansuppdrag under hela 2026, med chans till förlängning
* Omfattning: Heltid
* Placering: Gröna Lund
* Start: Omgående



  





 Uppdraget är ett konsult/frilans uppdrag där du fakturerar oss och därför behöver ha eget bolag eller enskild firma. Villkor och ersättning diskuteras vidare under rekryteringsprocessen. Ett uppdragsavtal tecknas innan uppdragets start.
 



  





**Ansökan och kontakt** 




 Sista ansökningsdag är den 30 januari. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, urval sker löpande! Har du frågor om rollen är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Robert Lövgren, Design- och Inhousechef på robert.lovgren@parksandresorts.com.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan, vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Product Designer, Visa Open Banking (Fixed-Term Contract)
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments technology, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories, dedicated to uplifting everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 At Visa, you'll have the opportunity to create impact at scale — tackling meaningful challenges, growing your skills and seeing your contributions impact lives around the world. Join Visa and do work that matters — to you, to your community, and to the world.
   

  





 Progress starts with you.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Tink was founded in 2012, with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. Tink has built Europe’s most robust Open Banking Platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of financial data. Tink became part of Visa in 2022. Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
   

  





 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Product Designer to join the Visa Open Banking team.
   

  





 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in creating best-in-class user interfaces and experiences, ensuring that users enjoy a seamless and engaging journey throughout the entire product flow. This role demands a keen eye for detail, creativity, and a deep understanding of user-centered design principles to consistently deliver exceptional and intuitive user experiences.
   

  





 Key Responsibilities:
   

  




* Deliver outstanding user experiences to customers through initial designs and iterative updates.
* Design from concept to implementation, considering usability, accessibility, localization, scalability, and — where relevant — crafting clear, concise interface copy that’s in line with UX writing best practices.
* Conduct user research studies to gather qualitative and quantitative data (usability testing, user interviews, A/B testing, etc) to understand customer needs, validate design decisions, and refine user experience.
* Collaborate effectively with diverse teams, ensuring smooth communication and high-quality design execution.
* Ensure all deliverables align with requirements and the established design system.
* Contribute to Visa’s Global Open Banking Platform design system in partnership with designers and developers ensuring it meets scalability, efficiency, and brand alignment requirements.
* Engage in constructive design critique with designers and cross-disciplinary partners.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in the office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager. ​
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* Experience in product design for mobile and web platforms, with a portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design work.
* Proven experience collaborating with cross-functional teams
* Fluency with design systems and technical implementations
* Ability to clearly present and explain design decisions to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong prototyping skills with a focus on clear and effective visual communication.
* Experience or strong interest in UX Writing and content strategy, with the ability to create clear, concise, and user-focused interface copy.
* Excellent command of visual design, UI patterns, and user-centered design principles.
* Solid experience in user research and usability testing.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in industry-standard design tools, particularly Figma.
* Experience in the payments or financial services industry is a plus.
* Advanced proficiency in English.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human–Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, User Experience, or a related field.
* This is a temporary position for 15 months, with no extension, starting from April 2026 to July 2027.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Next.js
* Typescript
* React.js
* React Native


**Meritorious**
* Tailwind / Shadcn
* Github Actions
* Jest / React Testing Library / Playwright
* Vercel
* Headless UI
* Headless CMS
* pnpm


**Application deadline:** 
 23-01-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Product Manager
description:
Howspace is a SaaS company in the Learning & Development (L&D) space, helping organizations run impactful learning and change initiatives. We are seeking a Product Manager to bridge the gap between vision and execution by aligning customer needs with commercial strategy. In this role, you will maximize product value while proactively shaping responsible, pragmatic AI opportunities that enhance usability and drive meaningful outcomes for our users.
 



  





**Here's what you can expect:** 



* A global, early-stage scale-up environment with high growth ambitions
* A human-centric company culture
* Hybrid or remote work environment in Finland, Sweden, or the Netherlands
* Annual base compensation of 60-70k €
* 50+ purpose-driven Howspacians working with you to bring meaningful change to life through collaborative learning and engagement!



  





  





**What will this role have ownership of?** 



* Shaping a clear product vision and roadmap aligned with company strategy
* Leading discovery to deeply understand customer problems and workflows
* Translating strategy into prioritized initiatives, features, and experiments
* Identifying opportunities for AI to enhance product value and efficiency
* Driving cross-functional collaboration with engineering, design, and commercial teams
* Prioritizing work based on customer impact, business value, and feasibility
* Ensuring all features are usable, explainable, and trusted by users
* Defining success metrics and monitoring outcomes for all initiatives
* Balancing short-term delivery with long-term product and data foundations
* Supporting go-to-market efforts with product insights and internal enablement



  





  





**What does the role require from you?** 



* Proven track record in product management and driving commercial success in B2B SaaS
* Exposure to building AI-enabled products or data-driven features
* Strategic thinking combined with a hands-on approach to practical execution
* Solid communication skills to influence without formal authority
* Ability to navigate ambiguity and stay ahead of evolving technologies
* A high degree of ownership and an ethical mindset, particularly regarding AI-related decisions
* Demonstrated track record of delivering measurable customer and business value
* Experience managing products in L&D or HR tech space is a plus
* Typically requires 3-5 years of experience in Product Management within high-growth B2B SaaS companies, and a relevant degree
* Fluent skills in English; additional European languages are an advantage



  





  





**We would love to hear from you!** 




 We encourage you to send in your application as soon as possible, as we will go through the applications on an ongoing basis. We value our diverse and inclusive workforce and encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the listed qualifications, but feel passionate and excited about the opportunity.

title: Technical Office Manager
description:
**Who we are** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing across Europe, currently with more than 14 active international offices. Netlight operates as a modern, self-managed organization where every team member actively shapes our technological future. We empower professionals to take ownership of their growth while driving digital transformation across diverse industries. We combine strategic excellence with collaborative leadership to deliver exceptional results for our global client base.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As Technical Office Manager, you will shape the technical foundation of our global office space experience. You’ll ensure that our 14 offices deliver a seamless, secure, and inspiring workplace - where technology just works.
 



  





 This role bridges workplace operations and technical coordination. You will combine hands-on execution with structured governance, working closely with Office Managers, Tech, vendors, and internal stakeholders to ensure that meeting room technology, booking systems, physical infrastructure, and office relocations run smoothly and consistently across all locations.
 



  





 You will be part of the First Impression team based in Stockholm, while your scope and impact span all our global offices.
 



  





 You will play a central role in defining standards, building structure, and turning complex office environments into simple, reliable, and scalable experiences for our employees.
 



  





 Travel will be part of the role as you visit offices, support projects, and build strong cross-city collaboration.
 



  





**How you'll shape and run our workspace technology** 




 You will develop and continuously improve the technical foundation of our global office experience. Your responsibility spans from strategy and standards to hands-on execution, ensuring that our offices are reliable, secure, efficient, and enjoyable places to work.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities** 




  





**Workplace technology, standards & lifecycle** 




 Define, implement, and maintain global standards for meeting room technology, booking systems, physical infrastructure, and office equipment. Own the full lifecycle - from setup and integration to maintenance, improvement, and retirement. Ensuring consistency, scalability, and quality user experience across all offices.
 



  





**Office infrastructure, compliance & security** 




 Ensure that physical office technology meets building standards, safety regulations, and security requirements. Manage power capacity, physical security alignment, and technical readiness during office changes and relocations.
 



  





**Office projects & relocations** 




 Lead the technical coordination of office openings, relocations, and refurbishments. Plan timelines, manage suppliers, and ensure smooth transitions with minimal disruption to daily operations.
 



  





**Vendors, contracts & procurement** 




 Manage supplier relationships, contracts, and procurement processes for workplace technology and physical office equipment. Ensure cost-effective solutions, strong delivery quality, and well-functioning partnerships.
 



  





**Inventory, budget & performance tracking** 




 Maintain a complete inventory of all physical office technology and take ownership of cost tracking, budgets, asset lifecycles, and performance reporting.
 



  





**User experience & support** 




 Provide first-line support for workplace technology, create documentation and training, gather feedback, and continuously improve usability, reliability, and employee satisfaction.
 



  





**Office strategy & continuous improvement** 




 Contribute to global office strategy together with Office Managers. Define and follow up on KPIs for uptime, service levels, space utilization, and user satisfaction, and drive continuous improvement aligned with global guidelines.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 You combine a strong technical interest with excellent organizational and coordination skills. You enjoy creating structure in complex environments, taking ownership, and turning ideas into well-functioning solutions. You’re comfortable working across teams and with external partners, and you take pride in making things run smoothly for others.
 



  





 You’re proactive, detail-oriented, and service-minded, with a natural ability to balance hands-on execution with a bigger-picture perspective. You communicate clearly, build trust easily, and thrive in a role where reliability, quality, and continuous improvement truly matter.
 



  





**Experience & background** 




 We believe the right mindset and skills matter most, but the following experience and background would be considered a strong advantage:
 



  





 - A post-secondary education in IT, facilities, or a related field.
 



 - Experience in workplace technology, IT operations, office/facilities, or technical coordination roles.
 



 - Experience with meeting room technology, AV systems, booking platforms, or digital signage.
 



 - Experience managing vendors, procurement, contracts, or budgets.
 



 - Experience coordinating projects such as office relocations, refurbishments, or technology rollouts.
 



 - A basic understanding of IT infrastructure, security, and compliance.
 



  





**We offer** 




 The opportunity to work with the technical foundation of our global office experience and shape how our workplaces function and scale.
 



  





 Exposure to a broad range of workplace technologies from AV to physical infrastructure, security, and smart office solutions - in a dynamic, multi-site environment.
 



  





 The chance to build structure, standards, where it truly matters, while still working hands-on in a role with visible, day-to-day impact.
 



  





 A collaborative culture where your ideas are valued, your ownership is trusted, and your work directly improves everyday life for colleagues across the organization.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Backend Developer – Join Us in Building the Future of Dairy Farming at DeLaval**
 Are you a seasoned backend developer who enjoys solving real-world problems with clean, scalable code? Do you want your work to have a meaningful impact beyond the screen? At DeLaval, we’re looking for a technically driven and collaborative S
 **enior Backend Developer** 
 to join our cross-functional team developing
 **DeLaval Plus** 
 – our digital platform supporting modern dairy farmers around the world.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 In this role, you’ll work closely with
 **Product Owners, Project Managers, Scrum Masters, UX Designers, QA Engineers, and other developers** 
 to build and maintain the backend services powering the
 **DeLaval Plus** 
 website. You’ll be involved in the
 **entire feature lifecycle** 
 – from design and development to testing, deployment, monitoring, and incident handling.
   

  

 You’ll help shape robust,
 **secure, scalable, and observable backend services** 
 using modern, cloud-native technologies. This role is ideal for someone who’s excited to deliver
 **reliable systems at scale** 
 , enjoys working with
 **data-intensive applications** 
 , and is passionate about making a difference in the lives of real users.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design, build, and maintain backend services for DeLaval Plus
* Collaborate with a cross-functional team to deliver high-quality features end to end
* Write secure and testable APIs following OWASP and clean code principles
* Manage infrastructure and deployments using modern IaC and DevOps tools
* Work on data-heavy services that are central to our platform’s performance and reliability
* Monitor services in production, respond to incidents, and continuously improve system resilience
* Contribute to our culture of learning and knowledge sharing


**Qualifications**
 We’re looking for someone with
 **at least 7 years of backend development experience** 
 . You should also have a
 **solid foundation in computer science** 
 , with strong knowledge of
 **algorithms, data structures, and system design** 
 .
   

  

 You also have hands-on experience with most or all of the following:
   

  

* Languages & Runtime: JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, npm
* Cloud & Infrastructure: AWS (Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, RDS, VPC), CDK, Kubernetes, Terraform
* Architecture & Patterns: REST API development, API security (authentication, authorization, OWASP best practices), event-driven architecture
* Testing & Quality: Jest (unit testing), Cypress (E2E), JMeter (load testing), SonarQube
* DevOps & Observability: Git, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Grafana, Loki, Sentry, OpsGenie
* Best Practices: Clean code, secure coding, code reviews, production monitoring, incident response
* Special Focus: Experience working with data-intensive and high-traffic applications
* Computer Science Fundamentals: Algorithms, data structures, system design


**Who You Are**
 You’re not just a developer – you’re a team player and a problem solver. We believe you’ll thrive here if you:
   

  

* Take responsibility for your work and follow through
* Have strong technical curiosity and a drive to continuously learn
* Are proactive and enjoy taking initiative
* Value collaboration and helping others succeed
* Have experience handling incidents and working with customer service to improve production systems
* Have worked with production-grade systems and understand the importance of qu ality, reliability, and supportability
* Are fluent in English (required) and preferably also in Swedish
* Are able and willing to work from our Tumba office at least 3 days per week


****Why DeLaval?****
 DeLaval is a global leader in dairy farming technology. We combine over 135 years of experience with cutting-edge digital innovation. By joining us, your code won’t just power a website – it’ll help farmers feed the world in a more sustainable way.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 Applications close on September 26. Please ensure your application is submitted before then. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. Apply today and help us shape the future of farming — one clean, simple line of code at a time. We’re growing our team and looking for more developers! Visit our careers page to explore all open roles.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Software Engineer - Merchant Onboarding
description:
What we do at Qliro
   

  

 At Qliro, we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly, and highly competent people who together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both in Sweden and the Nordics.
   

  

 What your team does
   

  

 The Merchant Onboarding team is building the future of how merchants get started with our checkout solution. We’re creating a self-service onboarding tool that lets merchants and agents configure payment options automatically through a user-friendly, intuitive UI. Our goal is to remove friction and make integration fast and simple, enabling Qliro to grow to new heights! 🚀
   

  

 We work in a modern, cloud-based environment with a strong focus on product thinking, developer experience, and great UX. You’ll be joining a collaborative, international team who learn and have fun together.
   

  

**Current focus for the team:**
 ✔ Building a self-service onboarding platform for merchants and agents with C#/.NET and React
   

  

 ✔ Creating intuitive, scalable UIs for payment configuration and checkout setup
   

  

 ✔ Being one of the key factors for making Qliro grow with new merchants every day
   

  

 ✔ Close collaboration between developers, product, and design
   

  

 ✔ A dedicated day every other week to be creative, try out ideas and learn something new
   

  

**Tech stack highlights:**
 C#, .NET (10), React, TypeScript, Tailwind, REST APIs, AWS, Terraform, Git, CI/CD, PostgreSQL, MongoDB
   

  

**What we are looking for in our new team member:**
 💡 Fullstack mindset – You’re comfortable working across backend and frontend, and enjoy owning features end-to-end
   

  

 🚀 Agile & quality-focused – You have hands-on experience with agile development and solid understanding of software engineering practices
   

  

 🧪 Testing & reliability – You value automated testing and building maintainable and scalable systems
   

  

 🤝 Team player - Strong communicator and team player who wants to drive initiatives and collaborate with others both in and outside of the team.
   

  

**Extra plus if:**
 👩‍🎨 Interest in design & UX – You care about how things look and feel, and enjoy building intuitive, merchant-friendly interfaces
   

  

 ☁️ Cloud-curious – Experience with AWS, Infrastructure-as-Code, or cloud platforms is a big plus
   

  

 💰 Payments or fintech experience – Nice to have, but not required
   

  

**Does this sound like your next role? What are you waiting for – apply now!**
*Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual* 
 orientation
 *or age* 
 .

title: Systemutvecklare Fullstack till Hjärt-Lungfonden
description:
Vill du använda din tekniska kompetens och lösningsförmåga för att bidra till att fler människor överlever hjärt- och lungsjukdomar? Hos Hjärt-Lungfonden får du utveckla system som gör verklig skillnad – samtidigt som du blir en del av ett engagerat team som driver verksamheten framåt med moderna tekniker, AI-stöd och smartare arbetssätt.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som
 **Systemutvecklare** 
**Fullstack** 
 hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen, driften och förvaltningen Systemutvecklare av Hjärt-Lungfondens egenutvecklade system, hemsidor och appar. Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans med andra, och som gillar att kombinera tekniskt hantverk med verksamhetsnytta och nära användarinteraktion.
 



  





**Du kommer att:** 



* Vidareutveckla våra system, hemsidor och appar – både reaktivt och proaktivt – samt deras integrationer mot andra plattformar och tjänster.
* Tillsammans med teamet ansvara för support, utbildning, förvaltning, rättning och drift av hela vår systempark.
* Utveckla komplexa flöden och integrationer i interna system
* Bidra i utformning av grafisk design, god användbarhet/UX samt spårning och analys
* Vara del av ett högpresterande och resultatinriktat team med högt tempo, tydliga mål och anpassade metoder
* Arbeta utifrån fastlagda mål och budget, och i linje med våra kommunikations- och segmentsstrategier.
* Bidra till övriga arbetsuppgifter som naturligt uppstår i ett modernt IT-team.



  





**Ditt arbete kommer vara centralt för att IT-teamet når sina mål:** 



* ligga i fas med verksamhetens behov av systemstöd
* maximera nyttan av AI och smarta lösningar som ger nytta över tid
* minska tiden för återkommande dataförfrågningar
* korta ledtider för supportärenden
* hålla hög kvalitet i drift och efterlever alla riktlinjer kring IT-miljön
* säkerställa driftsäkerhet utan oförklarade stopp



  





**Din kompetens** 




**Vi söker dig som har:** 




**Teknisk kompetens** 



* Goda kunskaper i systemutveckling med C#, .NET, React samt betydande erfarenhet av att bygga system och webbsidor av olika storlek och komplexitet.
* Omfattande erfarenhet av SQL
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och använda API-integrationer mellan system
* Erfarenhet av LINQ är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av Blazor och Typescript är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av AI-assisterad systemutveckling är meriterande



  





**Moderna arbetssätt** 




 Vana att arbeta med GIT för källkodshantering.
 



 Erfarenhet av automatiska pipelines, byggkedjor och continuous delivery.
 



 Erfarenhet av SCRUM och agila metoder.
 



  





**Vem du är** 




 Vi tror att du:
 


* Tar initiativ, ser helheten och driver utvecklingen framåt.
* Är pragmatisk, flexibel, lättlärd, nyfiken, resultatinriktad och prestigelös.
* Har ett analytiskt och strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Tar ansvar för att lösa problem effektivt, oavsett vilka hinder som uppstår
* Gillar att lära dig nya saker av och tillsammans med andra
* Gillar att ha en bred och varierande roll där du både utvecklar, stöttar verksamheten, löser problem och förbättrar processer.
* Trivs i ett team där man hjälps åt, delar kunskap och arbetar mot gemensamma mål.
* Har goda kunskaper i det svenska språket



 Du behöver inte kunna allt från dag ett – men du har drivet, erfarenheten och lärförmågan för att snabbt växa in i rollen.
 



  





**Om att jobba på Hjärt-Lungfondens IT-avdelning** 




**Kunskap är vår gemensamma superkraft** 




 Vi delar, lär och växer tillsammans. Vi letar aktivt efter tillfällen för kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling för både individerna och teamet.
 



  





**Samarbete är grunden för allt vi gör** 




 Vi är ett
 
 team. Frontend, backend, dataanalys, support – vi ser inte våra specialistområden som gränser, hela teamet ansvarar för hela uppdraget.
 



  





**Iterativ utveckling – vi bygger smart och stegvis** 




 Vi börjar med enklast möjliga grund och följer KISS-principen – inget onödigt, bara det som skapar värde. Vi bygger vidare på det som redan fungerar och gör små, stegvisa förbättringar. Vi fokuserar på vad som är möjligt och realistiskt istället för att fastna i principer eller hinder.
 



  





**Vi respekterar komplexitet och expertis** 




 Vi vet att vissa problem är svåra av en anledning. Vi respekterar att kunskap och erfarenhet varierar, genom att låta perspektivet hos den med djupast kunskap väga tyngst när vi väljer lösningar.
 



  





**Vi återanvänder smart** 




 När vi löser problem tänker vi långsiktigt. Vi återanvänder lösningar och kunskap i närliggande områden, istället för att uppfinna hjulet på nytt.
 



  





**Kommunikation inom teamet** 




 Vi kommunicerar tydligt, ärligt och regelbundet. Vi undviker antaganden och ställer frågor vid oklarheter. Vi uppdaterar status för våra arbetsuppgifter så att alla vet hur arbetet fortskrider. Vi ber aktivt om feedback på vårt arbete och implementerar förbättringar baserat på den.
 



  





**Gemensamt ansvar för effektiv tidsåtgång** 




 Om den estimerade tiden för en arbetsuppgift riskerar att överskridas, signalerar vi detta omedelbart och förklarar varför. Vi planerar och prioriterar utifrån högst verksamhetsnytta per tidsenhet, och är beredda att anpassa oss till förändrade krav eller omprioriteringar.
 



  





**Hjärt-Lungfondens organisationskultur** 




 Vår kultur bygger på fem vägledande principer som genomsyrar hur vi samarbetar och utvecklar verksamheten:
 



  





**Trovärdig** 




 Vi fattar faktabaserade beslut, levererar kvalitet och står för våra åtaganden.
 



  





**Omtänksam** 




 Vi skapar en inkluderande, hjälpsam och varm arbetsmiljö där vi bryr oss om varandra och våra givare.
 



  





**Nytänkande** 




 Vi är nyfikna, testar nytt och utvecklar våra arbetssätt och tekniska lösningar över tid.
 



  





**Tillsammans** 




 Vi samarbetar prestigelöst, delar kunskap och bygger lösningar som stärker helheten.
 



  





**Tillit** 




 Vi visar förtroende, snälltolkar och bidrar till en kultur där vi lär av varandra.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du arbeta i en organisation där engagemang, omtanke och professionalism går hand i hand.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 


* Arbeta för ett högre syfte – varje förbättring i våra system bidrar till livsviktig forskning.
* Ett team som satsar på kvalitet, automation, AI och smartare arbetssätt.
* En arbetsplats som värnar om balans, transparens och utveckling.
* Möjlighet att påverka både tekniska vägval och arbetsprocesser.
* Kollegor som bryr sig – om människor, resultat och vårt gemensamma uppdrag
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och hälsofrämjande insatser
* Möjlighet till distansarbete
* Fina och inspirerande lokaler i Gamla stan



  





 Vi tillämpar öppet lönespann som en del av det kommande lönetransparensdirektivet.
 



  





 För denna roll tänker vi att en månadslön ligger mellan 54 000–64000 kr, beroende på erfarenhet och kompetens.
 



  





**Praktiskt** 




 Placering: Stockholm, Gamla stan.
 



**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Vår policy är att alla anställda ska vara nikotinfria och vi tillämpar provanställning.
 



  





**Vill du vara med och skapa stabila, smarta och framtidssäkra system som gör skillnad på riktigt?** 




  





 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 13 februari 2026

title: Senior AI Programmer
description:
Overview


MachineGames is looking for a Senior AI Programmer to join our team and help us develop our next upcoming AAA title!

  

The programming team consists of talented and passionate programmers who are responsible for the development and maintenance of our technology.


In this role you will be reporting to our Lead Game Programmer and work closely together with our other programmers with a focus on our AI development.

  



To thrive in this role, we believe you are a generalist programmer with a keen interest in AI. You are comfortable working independently with little supervision but are equally as happy jumping into a bigger group collaboration when needed from time to time.

  



Our studio is located in central Uppsala, Sweden which is a small and vibrant city 40 minutes north of the capital, Stockholm. It has a historical heritage reaching back to pre-medieval times.

  

Our studio has a legacy of being down to earth and free from big egos, our everyday work as well as our long-term goals are driven by our studio values:

* *We value Team performance over individual performance*
* *We practice an open door policy*
* *We deliver what we promise*
* *We give constructive and actionable feedback*
* *We practice ownership and accountability*
* *We learn from our mistakes.*

  

This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible. We will support your relocation and/or your application for work permit if you do not have one or are not an EU citizen and/or not currently residing in Sweden. The role is onsite with the option to work in a hybrid capacity.


Responsibilities

* Architect and implement features in C/C++, that is CPU, GPU and memory efficient, with an eye to a quality end-user experience.
* Develop, extend and debug AI, tools, physics, animation, rendering, UI and gameplay code while respecting platform and design constraints, with focus on your area of expertise
* Collaborate well with programmers and other disciplines involved in the day-to-day work.
* Review code written by programmers across the studio and collaborate with them to improve code quality
* Help mentoring less experienced team members.
* If required, debug, modify, extend or use the tools pipeline as necessary.
* Construct solutions for unforeseen design problems in a timely manner.
* Proactively provides suggestions on how to utilize new technologies and tools and implement them into our workflow.


Qualifications

* Minimum 1 shipped title in the games industry credited as a Senior AI Programmer or equivalent.
* Demonstrates and applies strong problem-solving and debugging skills in C++.
* Write clean, professional, well commented and maintainable code.
* Show good knowledge of mathematics for 3d game development.
* Understand a large set of the many components that makes up a modern video game and show capabilities of independently take on tasks.
* Demonstrated experience from working on at least one or two fully shipped AAA game productions.
* Experience using Havok products, physics, AI.


Preferred Skills

* Knowledge and experience designing player companions.
* Experience working with utility based and hierarchal task network systems.
* Prior experience with idTech or other proprietary engine


We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do – from recruiting for our studios, publishing and operations to fostering safe and respectful workplaces that encourage collaboration. Our culture is based on principles of respect, inclusion, and fair treatment and we welcome anyone into our family without regard to race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age.


Our diversity fuels our innovation and inspires us to create game worlds that bring us closer to the global community of players we serve.

title: IT-ansvarig / Manager IT Operations & Compliance
description:
NTM fortsätter sin spännande tillväxtresa och söker nu en IT-ansvarig.
  
  

**Vill Du vara med och utveckla NTM:** s IT-miljö i Sverige?
  
  

NTM är en nordisk och internationell koncern som planerar, producerar och reparerar avfalls- och logistiklösningar. Vi erbjuder en modern och flexibel arbetsmiljö där du får stort ansvar, goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och samarbete över landsgränserna.
  
NTM är norra Europas ledande sopbilsleverantör och ett familjeägt företag från den svenskspråkiga kusten i Finland. NTM har levererat enheter i Sverige sedan 1961 och är nu inne i en expansiv tillväxtresa.
  
Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat och dynamiskt team som värdesätter samarbete, ansvar och utveckling. I denna rollen blir du en central funktion i att driva samt utveckla stabil och robust IT-drift för den svenska verksamheten i linje med utvecklingen på koncern nivå.
  
Ansvarsområden innefattar bl a
  
Ansvar för M365-miljö
  
  

Serverdrift, nätverk, molnlösningar och IT-säkerhet
  
  

ERP-administration
  
  

Hantering av arbetsstationer, telefoner och lokal IT-support
  
  

Leverantörskoordinering
  
  

Efterlevnad av NIS2, GDPR, Data ActSamarbete med koncernens IT för att säkerställa efterlevnad av gemensamma riktlinjer och standarder
  
  

Krav
  
Tidigare erfarenhet av IT-drift, MS365 och IT-infrastruktur
  
  

God förståelse för IT-säkerhet och kunskap om relevanta regelverk
  
  

Mycket goda kunskaper i både det svenska och engelska språket (både i tal och skrift)
  
  

Erfarenhet att koordinerar projekt och att arbeta i en internationell miljö
  
  

Vi ser det som meriterande om du har ERP-kunskap, Microsoft-certifieringar, erfarenhet av cybersäkerhet och/eller projektledning.
  
  

Övrigt
  
**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Arbetstider:** Kontorstid vardagar kl.07:00–16:00
  
**Placering:** Kalmar/Stockholm
  
**Anställningsform:** Heltid tillsvidare med inledande provanställning på 6 månader
  
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2026-02-15
  
För övriga frågor vänligen kontakta; conny.soder@ntmsverige.se
  
Vänligen notera att urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Dina svar på ansökningsfrågorna ligger till grund för bedömning av din ansökan.
  
Pga teknikaliteter hos Arbetsförmedlingen står Tillväxtinitiativet Kalmars partner Thread AB som arbetsgivare i annonsens faktatext längst ner på annonsen i platsbanken. Tjänsten som beskrivs ovan är hos den arbetsgivare som omnämns i ovanstående text och det är också de som blir din arbetsgivare om det blir du som får tjänsten. Arbetsgivaren får rekryteringsstöd av Tillväxtinitiativet Kalmar för att hitta just dig.

title: Junior E-commerce Specialist
description:
Vill du ta ditt första steg inom e-commerce i en internationell miljö? Nu finns möjligheten att bli en del av ett växande team på ett etablerat bolag där du får arbeta både administrativt och kommunikativt med digital försäljning.
  
  

**OM TJÄNSTEN:**  

Vi rekryterar nu till en instegsroll inom e-commerce till ett internationellt bolag inom fordonsindustrin. Rollen är ny och tillsätts som ett komplement till en befintlig tjänst i teamet, i takt med att bolagets onlineförsäljning växer och e-kanalen rullas ut på fler marknader.
  
Du blir en del av ett sammansvetsat team med mycket god kemi, något vi värdesätter högt. För att säkerställa ett bra ömsesidigt match kommer rekryteringsprocessen att inkludera panelintervjuer där flera delar av teamet deltar.
  
Tjänsten passar dig som är i början av din karriär och vill bygga en stabil grund inom e-commerce, digital försäljning och marknadsföring i en internationell miljö.
  
**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:** Administrativt arbete kopplat till uppstart och vidareutveckling av webshops, exempelvis uppladdning av produkter och artiklar samt hantering av större datamängder
  
Säkerställa att e-handelsplattformen är användarvänlig, visuellt tilltalande och innehåller tydliga produktbeskrivningar
  
Stöd i utrullningen av e-kanalen på nya marknader, inklusive utbildning och support till återförsäljare
  
Trafikdrivande insatser via exempelvis sök, sociala medier, displayannonser och e-postutskick
  
Online shopper marketing, såsom kampanjer, erbjudanden, rabatter och produktrekommendationer
  
**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:** Är i början av din karriär och ser detta som ett första eller tidigt steg inom e-commerce eller digital försäljning
  
Har en akademisk utbildning inom relevant område
  
Är mycket bekväm i Excel och van vid att arbeta strukturerat med data
  
Har förståelse för eller intresse av CRM- och affärssystem, exempelvis Salesforce (meriterande men inget krav)
  
Är noggrann, nyfiken och har en vilja att lära och utvecklas över tid
  
  

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du trivs i en roll där arbetsuppgifterna varierar och där du får möjlighet att växa tillsammans med ett team i en organisation med tydliga ambitioner inom e-commerce. Vi ser att du är noggrann, nyfiken och har en vilja att utvecklas över tid. Vidare är du kommunikativ, pedagogisk och trivs med att samarbeta med både interna team och externa partners.
  
  

**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:**  

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kundens och vår sida är att du efter 9 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.
  
  

**ÖVRIG INFO:**  

**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Start:** Omgående
  
**Placering:** Eskilstuna
  
**Lön:** Marknadsmässig
  
  

**OM FRIDAY:**  

Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framför allt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.
  
Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!
  
Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.
  
Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?

title: IT Project & Solution Lead
description:
Vill du vara med och driva digital utveckling - från behov till verklig nytta? Hos oss på Luotea får du en nyckelroll i att omsätta verksamhetens behov till hållbara IT-lösningar, i nära samarbete med verksamheten, IT och externa partners.
  
  

I rollen som IT Project & Solution Lead arbetar du mitt i gränslandet mellan affär och teknik. Ditt fokus ligger på att leda, samordna och säkerställa leverans av IT-initiativ som skapar affärsvärde. Rollen är primärt ledande och koordinerande (utan formellt personalansvar), snarare än hands-on utveckling, men det finns möjlighet att bidra operativt där det skapar värde.
  
  

Du blir en del av vårt IT-team och får en viktig roll i att driva initiativ, projekt, strukturera utvecklingsarbete och vidareutveckla våra arbetssätt.
  
  

Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden
  
  

* Leda och driva kravarbete och behovsinsamling tillsammans med verksamheten
* Strukturera, prioritera och förvalta utvecklings- och förändringsbacklog
* Fungera som brygga mellan verksamhet, IT och externa leverantörer
* Leda IT-projekt och implementationer (planering, uppföljning, risker, leveranser)
* Säkerställa att lösningar är ändamålsenliga ur process-, säkerhets- och regelefterlevnadsperspektiv (t.ex. NIS2)
* Följa upp leverantörer, resurser, avtal och leveranskvalitet
* Bidra till förbättrade IT-processer, styrning och arbetssätt
* Stötta värderealisering och uppföljning av genomförda initiativ


Vi söker dig som har
  
  

* Erfarenhet av att leda IT-projekt, systemimplementationer eller förändringsinitiativ
* Vana att driva kravarbete, planering, test och dialog med verksamheten
* Förståelse för systemlandskap, integrationer och affärssystem (t.ex. ERP), utan krav på djup teknisk spets
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med externa leverantörer och partners
* En strukturerad arbetsstil och trygghet i att leda, koordinera och prioritera


Meriterande
  
  

* Erfarenhet av regulatoriska krav (t.ex. informationssäkerhet, NIS2, GDPR)
* Erfarenhet från verksamhetsnära IT i större organisationer
* Bakgrund inom systemutveckling eller teknisk förvaltning


Som person är du
  
  

* Tydlig, kommunikativ och förtroendeskapande
* Strukturerad med förmåga att skapa ordning i komplexa miljöer
* Trygg i att fatta beslut och hålla riktning även när allt inte är färdigdefinierat
* Lösningsorienterad och helhetsfokuserad, du ser hur teknik, process och verksamhet hänger ihop
* En naturlig samordnare som får människor att arbeta mot gemensamma mål


Varför Luotea?
  
  

Hos oss får du en roll med stort utrymme att påverka, där du blir en central del i vår fortsatta digitala utveckling. Du får arbeta nära verksamheten, vara med och forma hur vi driver IT-initiativ och bidra till att bygga strukturer som håller över tid. Du får även möjlighet att arbeta internationellt med kollegor från vår Finska verksamhet.
  
  

Vi erbjuder en varierad vardag, korta beslutsvägar och möjligheten att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas, ta ansvar och göra verklig skillnad genom IT som skapar affärsnytta.
  
  

Ansökan
  
  

Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer och önskar därför få din ansökan så snart som möjligt. När du skickat in din ansökan får du ett bekräftelsemail.
  
  

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Ivo Kukavica på ivo.kukavica@luotea.com
  
  

Vi undanber oss all kontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.
